page.title: 12HIGHFIELD HOUSE
page.content: Before the farm was titled Highfield House it was known as Leigh Farm.Mr. Sharp(the farmer)rents 131.5 ha(325 acres)for his crops of sugar beet, wheat, barley,oats,peas, potatoes and grass for hay.The rotation period of the fields is 4-5 years,this is the way the fields are worked:-barley,one year,sugar beet the next year,barley for another year,peas the next year, then wheat,after that the process starts again.The farmer owns 1 combine harvester.If the weather is good Mr. Sharp gets-up at 4.00a.m.,but usually he gets-up about 7.00a.m.He does not need to get-up early to feed his animals because he does not have any. At harvest he employs boys over 13 to drive his 2 tractors.his soil varies brtween rich and stony.He owns a big fertilizer,and hand-sprayers for weed killer,an elevator & a beet harvester.
